##	Score (with Data) Network Overview

- Goal: Create a national network for developing and disseminating Sports Content for Outreach, Research, and Education in data science.

- Description: This four-year collaborative effort will create a network of educators and 50+ partners from sports teams and industry experts  across the country to develop authentic curricular modules to introduce data science topics via sports applications.

- Funding Acknowledgement: NSF Award #2142705. _Building a sustainable national network for developing and disseminating Sports Content for Outreach, Research, and Education in data science._

-	Team: [The 2023 Roster](https://scorenetwork.org/roster.html){target="_blank"}

- [Data Github repository](https://data.scorenetwork.org/){target="_blank"}
    - Curates interesting datasets across a variety of sports for use in statistics and data science education. Includes: 
        - A sports question of interest, with context motivating why the dataset is relevant and interesting to explore.
        - A statistics / data science topic which the dataset can be used to help teach.
        - Example questions that instructors can use to help build lessons, handouts, and SCORE modules.

##	Example SCORE modules

-	Ironman module
    -	Introductory [video](http://myslu.stlawu.edu/~msch/SCORE/SarahTrueTriathlonModule.mp4){target="_blank"}
    -	Break into small groups and work through [handout](https://github.com/iramler/slu_score/tree/main/triathlon_womens_ironman){target="_blank"}
    -	A few things to consider while working on it
        - How would you use this with your students?
        - What would you modify to fit your teaching style?
    - Group Discussion
	
-	Time permitting: Break into groups based on interest
    -	[Stolen Bases (ISLE)](https://isle.stat.cmu.edu/SCORE/stolen-bases-module/ ){target="_blank"}: Testing for Normality
    -	[Marathon (ISLE)](https://isle.stat.cmu.edu/SCORE/marathons/){target="_blank"}: Modeling random occurence (using Exponential distribution)
    -	[Lacrosse: PLL vs NLL](https://github.com/iramler/slu_score/tree/main/lacrosse_pll_vs_nll){target="_blank"}: Difference in means
    -	[League of Legends](){target="_blank"}: Outlier detection
    -	[PGA](https://github.com/iramler/slu_score/tree/main/pga_drive_putt){target="_blank"}: ???
        - No/low tech version
        - Statistical Software required

    -	[Soccer](){target="_blank"}: One-way ANOVA
    - [NCAA Div I Softball](){target="_blank"}: Joining/Merging Data Tables (based on dplyr syntax)
